name: Lawrence HARPER, Petitioner v. COMMON PLEAS COURT OF PHILADELPHIA, County Clerk of the Court (Crim. Div.) and President Judge Pamela Prior Dembe, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Harper v. Common Pleas Court of Philadelphia

pin_cites.parenthetical: explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted
explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted

parties: Lawrence HARPER, Petitioner v. COMMON PLEAS COURT OF PHILADELPHIA, County Clerk of the Court (Crim. Div.) and President Judge Pamela Prior Dembe, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 13th day of November, 2015, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Ali, 608 Pa. 71, 10 A.3d 282 (2010) (explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted) The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record and to strike the name of the jurist from the caption.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
125 A.3d 772
Lawrence HARPER, Petitioner v. COMMON PLEAS COURT OF PHILADELPHIA, County Clerk of the Court (Crim. Div.) and President Judge Pamela Prior Dembe, Respondents.
No. 118 EM 2015.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 13, 2015.
